relationships.description: Founder and leader of Econet Wireless
Chief Executive Officer of Econet Wireless
Five-year legal battle for telecommunications license

analysis.purpose: To profile Strive Masiyiwa's business achievements and future goals with Econet Wireless in Africa
analysis.significance: Documents the transformation of Zimbabwe's financial system through mobile technology and ambitious plans for financial inclusion across Africa

notable_quotes: "Today 43 percent of the GDP moves through Econet Wireless"
"We do not expect anyone to still be using paper money in a year's time. It will be just like Europe or America, where you no longer see people carrying bundles of cash."
"The big frontier for us is to create platforms where those people can access credit."

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this business profile article

illegal_activity.description: This is a news article profiling business achievements and financial innovation, containing no evidence of illegal activity

details: Reference to Mastercard Foundation Symposium presentation
Public speaking engagement in Turin, Italy

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be a published news article from New Zimbabwe and UK Guardian about business innovation in African telecommunications and finance

analysis.summary: This news article profiles Strive Masiyiwa, founder of Econet Wireless, detailing his company's transformation of Zimbabwe's financial system through mobile payments and ambitious plans to create Africa's first cashless society while expanding financial inclusion to the poorest populations.
